SEARCH
Package com.weather.sdk.model

Class SystemInfo

java.lang.Object
com.weather.sdk.model.SystemInfo
public final class SystemInfo extends Object
Represents system information including sunrise and sunset times.

This class encapsulates the system-related weather information from the OpenWeatherAPI response, providing astronomical data such as sunrise and sunset times for the location.

System Information

  • Sunrise: Time of sunrise for the location
  • Sunset: Time of sunset for the location

Time Format

All times are provided as Unix timestamps (seconds since January 1, 1970 UTC). This class provides convenient methods for converting to Java Date objects and formatted time strings.

JSON Mapping

Mapped from OpenWeatherAPI response: 

 {
   "sys": {
     "sunrise": 1675751262,
     "sunset": 1675787560
   }
 }
Since:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • SystemInfo

      public SystemInfo()
      Default constructor for Jackson deserialization.

    • SystemInfo

      public SystemInfo(long sunrise, long sunset)
      Constructs a new SystemInfo instance.
      Parameters:
      sunrise - the sunrise time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
      sunset - the sunset time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either timestamp is negative or sunset is before sunrise

  • Method Details

    • getSunrise

      public long getSunrise()
      Returns the sunrise time as Unix timestamp.
      Returns:
      the sunrise timestamp in seconds since epoch. Always non-negative.

    • getSunset

      public long getSunset()
      Returns the sunset time as Unix timestamp.
      Returns:
      the sunset timestamp in seconds since epoch. Always non-negative.

    • setSunrise

      public void setSunrise(long sunrise)
      Sets the sunrise time as Unix timestamp.
      Parameters:
      sunrise - the sunrise time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sunrise timestamp is negative

    • setSunset

      public void setSunset(long sunset)
      Sets the sunset time as Unix timestamp.
      Parameters:
      sunset - the sunset time as Unix timestamp (seconds). Must be non-negative.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sunset timestamp is negative

    • getSunriseDate

      public Date getSunriseDate()
      Returns the sunrise time as a Java Date object.
      Returns:
      the sunrise date object. Never returns null.

    • getSunsetDate

      public Date getSunsetDate()
      Returns the sunset time as a Java Date object.
      Returns:
      the sunset date object. Never returns null.

    • getDayLength

      public Duration getDayLength()
      Returns the duration of daylight (sunset - sunrise).
      Returns:
      the duration of daylight. Always non-negative.

    • getDayLengthHours

      public double getDayLengthHours()
      Returns the duration of daylight in hours.
      Returns:
      the daylight duration in hours as a decimal number.

    • getDayLengthHoursAndMinutes

      public int[] getDayLengthHoursAndMinutes()
      Returns the duration of daylight in hours and minutes.
      Returns:
      an array where [0] is hours and [1] is minutes

    • isDaytime

      public boolean isDaytime()
      Checks if the current time falls within daytime hours.

      Note: This method compares against the current system time and uses the sunrise/sunset times from the weather data. For precise calculations, consider the timezone offset from the parent WeatherData.

      Returns:
      true if the current time is between sunrise and sunset, false otherwise

    • isBeforeSunrise

      public boolean isBeforeSunrise()
      Checks if the current time is before sunrise.
      Returns:
      true if current time is before sunrise, false otherwise

    • isAfterSunset

      public boolean isAfterSunset()
      Checks if the current time is after sunset.
      Returns:
      true if current time is after sunset, false otherwise

    • getTimeUntilSunrise

      public Optional<Duration> getTimeUntilSunrise()
      Calculates the time until next sunrise.
      Returns:
      the duration until next sunrise, or empty if currently daytime

    • getTimeUntilSunset

      public Optional<Duration> getTimeUntilSunset()
      Calculates the time until next sunset.
      Returns:
      the duration until next sunset, or empty if currently nighttime

    • formatSunrise

      public String formatSunrise(String pattern)
      Formats the sunrise time using the specified pattern.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the date format pattern (e.g., "HH:mm", "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm")
      Returns:
      the formatted sunrise time string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the pattern is invalid

    • formatSunset

      public String formatSunset(String pattern)
      Formats the sunset time using the specified pattern.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the date format pattern (e.g., "HH:mm", "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm")
      Returns:
      the formatted sunset time string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the pattern is invalid

    • getSunriseTimeString

      public String getSunriseTimeString()
      Returns the sunrise time as a localized time string.
      Returns:
      the sunrise time in "h:mm a" format (e.g., "7:27 AM")

    • getSunsetTimeString

      public String getSunsetTimeString()
      Returns the sunset time as a localized time string.
      Returns:
      the sunset time in "h:mm a" format (e.g., "6:52 PM")

    • getSunriseTime24h

      public String getSunriseTime24h()
      Returns the sunrise time in 24-hour format.
      Returns:
      the sunrise time in "HH:mm" format (e.g., "07:27")

    • getSunsetTime24h

      public String getSunsetTime24h()
      Returns the sunset time in 24-hour format.
      Returns:
      the sunset time in "HH:mm" format (e.g., "18:52")

    • getDayLengthDescription

      public String getDayLengthDescription()
      Returns a human-readable description of the day length.
      Returns:
      a description like "11 hours 24 minutes" or "14 hours 32 minutes"

    • isNearSunriseOrSunset

      public boolean isNearSunriseOrSunset()
      Indicates whether it's currently close to sunrise or sunset (within 1 hour).
      Returns:
      true if within 1 hour of sunrise or sunset

    • formatSunriseSunset

      public String formatSunriseSunset()
      Returns sunrise and sunset information as a formatted string.
      Returns:
      a formatted string containing sunrise and sunset times
